arm_group.description: The investigators measure quality of chest compressions before nightshift. Control group
The investigators measure quality of chest compressions before nightshift. After night shift group

brief_summary.textblock:
The investigators sought to evaluate the influence of fatigue after a night shift on the
      quality of Chest Compressions (CC) in CardioPulmonary Resuscitation (CPR), among
      physicians.

clinical_study.brief_title: Quality of Chest Compressions After a Night Shift

detailed_description.textblock:
This is a non inferiority cluster randomized trial on three Emergency Departments (ED) and
      five Intensive Care Unit (ICU) from three urban academic hospital in Paris, France. The
      investigators evaluated the quality of CC with a low-fidelity manikin and its electronic
      feedback device. The investigators tested subjects on a 6-minutes CC-only CPR scenario,
      including 2 minutes of pause. Physicians were tested either on a control day then after a
      night shift, or after a night shift then on a control day.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Resident / Physicians in emergency departement (ED) or taking night in ED

          -  Resident / Physicians in Intensive Care Unit (ICU) or taking night in ED

          -  Nightshift > 18 hours

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Stop chest compressions before 2 minutes

intervention.description: Simulated cardiac arrest on a manikin Chest Compression CPR for 6 minutes

facility.name: Hôpital Pitié-Salpêtrière; Hopital Saint Antoine; Hopital Tenon

clinical_study.official_title: Weaker Chest Compression After Nightshift : The We CAN Study.

other_outcome.description: The investigators assessed factors associated with better chest compressions as : age, sex and fatigue of physician and intensity of the nightshift.
other_outcome.measure: Factors associated with better chest compressions (CC)

overall_official.affiliation: Emergency Department, Hôpital Pitié-Salpêtrière, 47-83 Boulevard de l'Hôpital, 75013 Paris, France.

oversight_info.authority: France: Conseil National de l'Ordre des Médecins

primary_outcome.description: The investigators evaluated the quality of CC with a low-fidelity manikin and its electronic feedback device.
primary_outcome.measure: the proportion of CC with a depth higher than 50mm

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: The investigators evaluated the quality of CC with a low-fidelity manikin and its electronic feedback device.

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Crossover Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Diagnostic
